Description: Job Title: Telecom Project ManagerA project manager is a person who has the overall responsibility for the successful initiation, planning, designing, executing, monitoring, controlling, and closing of a project.Objective:1- To plan, develop a budget, oversee & document all aspects of the E2E Managed Services Project for both delivery & maintenance.2- To work closely with the top management to make sure that the scope & budget & direction of the project is on schedule, as well as other departments for support.3- To assure that the project achieves the specific KPIs for managed services.Roles & Essential Function:1- Preparation of Project operation procedures & follow-up.2- KPIs Monitoring & Follow-up & issue (Daily-Weekly-Monthly) Reports for each KPI.3- Productivity Monitoring & Follow-up & issue reports on (Installation & Maintenance) for Both I&R & OSP for Fiber 4- Copper, HFO & EFO business sectors.5- Finding creative solutions to increase productivity, improve KPIs & reduce cost.6- Follow-up on invoicing & clearing payments with STC.7- Coaching & training of the project teams.8- Resources Planning Management (Manpower, Tools & Transportation).9- Analyzing, controlling, and minimizing risk & uncertainty.10- Developing scheduling, estimating time & cost, documenting, monitoring & reporting progress, quality controlling & benefits realization.11- Applying lessons learned, defining roles and responsibilities, leading project planning, tracking & performing risk management, applying best practices., promoting good working relationships and making things happen.12- Managing all phases of project development to ensure user satisfaction, project continuity, internal consistency, and timely delivery of services.  13- Managing and coordinating with technical, and non-technical staff by establishing performance measures, goals, objectives, and priorities, providing direction & receiving feedback.14- Managing relationships & follow up with Support Services Dept. and Sub-contractors to ensure equipment and services procured and installed meet requirements and specifications;15- Evaluate overall & individual work performance to determine effectiveness in providing quality products within time and cost restraints;Skills
Skills: 5- Good communication skills is a must.
